title: 114_hr1157
content: The Act titled "Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2016" authorizes the transfer of land in trust for the Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Mission Indians. The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2016 authorizes the transfer of land into trust for the Tribe, to be administered as part of the Santa Ynez Indian Reservation in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2016 allows for the transfer of land in Santa Barbara County, California, into trust for the Tribe. This transfer removes restrictions on the property under California State laws. The legal description includes subdivisions of the Canada de los Pinos or College Rancho in Santa Barbara County, California. It pertains to parcels 2 and 3, detailing specific lots and tracts as shown on official records. This description is made in accordance with certificates of compliance recorded in 2001. Parcel 4 in Santa Barbara County, California, includes lots 1 through 12 of Tract 25 as shown on an official map. This legal description is based on a certificate of compliance recorded in 2001. Parcel 5 in Santa Barbara County, California, includes a portion of Lots 3 and 6 of Tract 16 as shown on a map filed in the County Recorder's office. This legal description is based on a certificate of compliance recorded in 2001. The Tribe's rights to land, water rights, and access to rights-of-way cannot be affected by the Act. The Tribe is restricted from conducting gaming activities on transferred lands under any claimed authority or Federal law. The Act does not affect the Tribe's rights to land, water rights, and access to rights-of-way. The Secretary of the Interior is defined as the "Secretary" and the Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Mission Indians is defined as the "Tribe."
